isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Recondition - Inspect Valve Springs

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not grind valve springs or use a wire brush for cleaning. Disruption of spring surface may cause fatigue cracks and spring failure.

step1.para: Clean valve springs in a suitable solvent.
Inspect valve springs for rust, cracks, and pitting. Replace any damaged valve springs.
Inspect both ends of each valve spring at contact points between the cutoff end of the last coil and the adjacent coil. If the cutoff end has worn a notch in the adjacent coil, replace the spring.

note.para: Valve spring wear notches can also be detected by compressing the spring and listening for a clicking sound.

figure.caption: Measure perpendicularity and flatness of valve spring

note.para: Valve springs that are not perpendicular to a flat surface put an unequal load on the valve stem, causing premature valve and valve guide wear.

step1.para: Use a square to check flatness and perpendicularity of spring ends. If the end of any valve spring is not flat and square, replace spring.

Use a Valve and Clutch Spring Tester
to measure valve spring tension. Measure the maximum and minimum lengths of the spring at appropriate test loads (valve closed and valve open). Replace any valve spring that does not meet Specifications .
